text: The year 2016 was the 3rd year in the history of the Kunlun Fight, a kickboxing promotion based in China. 2016 started with Kunlun Fight 36. The events were broadcasts through television agreements in mainland China with Jiangsu TV and around the world with various other channels. The events were also streamed live on the Kunlun Fight app. Traditionally, most Kunlun Fight events have both tournament fights and superfights (single fights). ==Champions== {| id="Events" class="wikitable sortable" style="width:80%; font-size:90%;" |- ! scope="col" |Weight ! scope="col" |Name ! scope="col" |Event ! scope="col" |Date ! scope="col" |Notes |- |MMA Welterweight | Sai Wang |Kunlun Fight 36 | |MMA Title Fight |- |Kickboxing 75 kg | Zhaoyu Zheng |Kunlun Fight 41/Kunlun Fight 42/Kunlun Fight 47 | |2016 Multi-Part 16-man World Championship Tournament |- |Kickboxing 65 kg | Wei Ninghui |Kunlun Fight 49/Kunlun Fight 51 | |2016 Multi-Part 16-man World Championship Tournament |- |Kickboxing 95+kg | Andrei Gerasimchuk |Kunlun Fight 48/Kunlun Fight 52 | |2016 Multi-part 8-man World Championship Tournament |- |Muay Thai 70 kg | Buakaw Banchamek |Kunlun Fight 53 | |70 kg Muay Thai Title Fight |- |MMA Strawweight | Weili Zhang |Kunlun Fight 53 | |Women's MMA Title Fight |- |MMA Welterweight | Lipeng Zhang |Kunlun Fight 53 | |MMA Title Fight |- |Kickboxing 80 kg | Alexander Stetsurenko |Kunlun Fight 50/Kunlun Fight 55 | |2016 Multi-part 8-man World Championship Tournament |- |MMA Strawweight | Weili Zhang |Kunlun Fight MMA 7 | |Women's MMA Title Fight |- |Kickboxing 70 kg | Superbon Banchamek |Kunlun Fight 40/Kunlun Fight 48/Kunlun Fight 53/Kunlun Fight 56 | |2016 Multi-part 64-man World Championship Tournament |- |Kickboxing 61.5 kg | Anissa Haddaoui |Kunlun Fight 64 | |Women's 2016 Multi-part Legend of Mulan 8-woman World Championship Tournament.
